timeline.message:
Add Boxplot Aggregation

Adds a `boxplot` aggregation that calculates min, max, medium and the first
and the third quartiles of the given data set.

Closes #33112

timeline.author: polyfractal

timeline.bodyText: Out of curiosity, did you look into extending AbstractTDigestPercentilesAggregator?  It might avoid some code duplication, but otoh it probably does more than you want/need.  No strong feelings here.... the percentile/ranks code is already a complicated hierarchy so might be easier to just keep this separate.
timeline.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: I wonder if it'd be cleaner to make a class they could both delegate their common behavior to? It'd be cool to do that in a follow up change if it is tricky.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, noodled on this a bit and it's probably too much for this PR (especially with #51887 potentially in the works)
The main difficulty is that percentiles/ranks share TDigest and HDRHisto agg base classes, and this would just share with TDigest, so it'd be a fork in the tree in the middle somewhere.
AbstractTDigestBase --> AbstractTDigestPercentiles --> Percentiles
                                                  \--> Ranks
                   \--> Boxplot

Unsure if the extra complexity is worth it or not. 🤷‍♂️  But probably too much complexity for this PR.
replies.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: I think it is up to @imotov but I'm fine waiting on it.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: I looked at it when it was still IQR and it was immediate dead-end from the inheritance perspective because of IQR was a single value/multivalue agg. It might be a bit easier now but I agree with @nik9000 and still think we should do some refactoring by composition (instead of inheritance) here. However, I would prefer to do it in another PR.
replies.author: imotov

timeline.bodyText:
Should we include format in this equality check?
Philosophically, I wonder if we should check equality of the boxplot components instead of the state? Like, are two boxplots identical if min/max/q1/q2/q3 are the same but the rest of the distribution is different?
I really dunno heh :)
timeline.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: It is already included in super.
replies.author: imotov

timeline.bodyText: Is this comment leftover?  E.g. the delta looks like it's zero?
timeline.author: polyfractal

timeline.bodyText: Do we need these any more?
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText:
Hmm, I'm not sure tbh.  We might want to keep them around as a bridge to the HLRC?  E.g. InternalMin and ParsedMin both implement Min, and it might help us make sure they don't diverge?
Or maybe useless bloat now that the TC is gone and we can get rid of them... but probably better to investigate that in a separate PR and apply it to all aggs if we decide we can remove them?
replies.author: polyfractal

replies.bodyText: The HLRC won't have Boxplot on the classpath because it doesn't have the analytics module. With top_metrics I just pointed folks to ParsedTopMetrics. I'm fine either way. It is just that when I made my new agg I figured I could save myself a little work an not make it.
replies.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Argh, you're right.  Keep forgetting this is in xpack.  👍 probably not necessary given the current situation
replies.author: polyfractal

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if it'd be better to use the field from the PercentilesAggregationBuilder. That at least is a hint that it means the same thing.
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: I think if you've declared the setter you may as well use it here.
timeline.author: nik9000

replies.bodyText: Also that'd gt your validation too.
replies.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Could you name these in SHOUTING_SNAKE_CASE like normal Java enums? Is there a super compelling reason not to?
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: Would you be making a private method on Metrics that takes this as a parameter and calls the right method instead?
timeline.author: nik9000

timeline.bodyText: I thought that these Fields objects had gone out of favor. But I'm not really in the loop.
timeline.author: nik9000
